entities.label: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK)
Military Units of the Kosovo Force (KFOR)

edges.label: 1. Audit Conducted
edges.tooltip: Chartered Accountants conducted an audit at Pristina International Airport, highlighting potential irregularities.

edges.label: 2. Audit Triggered Investigation
edges.tooltip: The audit findings led to the initiation of an investigation (Case 0282/04) into procurement activities.

edges.label: 3. Investigation Conducted By
edges.tooltip: UNMIK conducted the investigation based on the audit findings.

edges.label: 4. Oversight Authority
edges.tooltip: UNMIK was responsible for overseeing compliance at Pristina International Airport.

edges.label: 5. Contract Clearance Omission
edges.tooltip: Contracts were not submitted to the UNMIK Office of Legal Adviser for clearance, violating procedures.

edges.label: 6. Role Conflict Identified
edges.tooltip: DOTI Official 2 confirmed the conflict of role in the bid opening and technical evaluation committees.

edges.label: 7. Violation Found
edges.tooltip: The investigation found violations of the UNMIK Finance Administrative Instruction 1999/2.

DOTI Official 2: Confirmed involvement in role conflict within procurement committees.

UNMIK Finance Administrative Instruction: Tender specifications did not comply with Article 23.3.
Conflict of role in procurement committees.
Contracts not cleared by the legal adviser.
